newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway shares flat despite support in blue chips.
newsitem.headline: Norway shares flat despite support in blue chips.

text.p: Norwegian shares were unchanged on Friday despite good support for cyclical stocks and positive sentiment stemming from Germany's interest rate cut on Thursday.
Brokers said the market was expected to stay flat to slightly positive over the coming week in the absence of external impulses.
The Total share index closed 0.35 points up at 286.03 points in turnover of 635 million crowns.
"There was really nothing happening today," said one dealer. "The market's feeling is good following the rate cut yesterday but there were no impulses. Anyway it's Friday."
Demand remained healthy for insurance group UNI Storebrand which climbed a further 0.40 crowns to 35.90 crowns in trade worth 73.5 million crowns.
UNI has climbed 1.50 crowns, or nearly 4.4 percent since Wednesday, on buying interest from mainly overseas investors.
